intro: Eupatorium sordidum var. atrorubens, commonly known as black-red thoroughwort, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It features tall, erect stems that are often reddish-brown in color, and it produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are usually hairy and have a somewhat rough texture. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Asteraceae family.
